intro: Mespilodaphne fasciculata, commonly known as the slender sycamore, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lanceolate leaves that are arranged in whorls of three. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
